comments.commentBody: So good to know that Obama's administration was smart enough and cared enough to do this. May not have been perfect but sure was thoughtful and smart. Wish he was still there. Look at the mess we're in now because of this rigged election. Boy, do I miss Obama.

I think that investigative journalists should take a good look into the Russian born financier who was behind the failed Trump International Hotel in Toronto & his connections with Trump.The financier has strong connections to Ukraine, and made money in the steel business. What was the relationship,if any, between Trump's early adviser, Paul Manafort and the Russian investor,Alex Shnaider?

We have what can only be viewed as an astounding number of Trump campaign and administration figures who were chatting with the Russians, getting paid by their propaganda channels, running their puppet's campaigns, being presented with medals by Putin... We now have a Secretary of State with massive Russian interests, and a attorney general who communicated with the Russians at a key time in the campaign (Sept 8), and lied about it. We have public request from our now president requesting that the Russians hack his opponent's campaign. We have "hints" of surrogates about upcoming "surprises" anticipating the wiki-leaks disclosures, and absolute proof that the Russians were doing all they could to elect Trump.

Meanwhile, we have strong evidence (from Trump's kids) that Russian investment is very important to the Trump businesses. We also have Trump acting like he really has something to hide about his finances with his lies about not being able to release his tax information. Finally, there is the intelligence dossier that has at least been partially confirmed.

Had Clinton won, and this evidence was found pointing at her and her team, there can be absolutely no question that Republicans would have begun impeachment proceedings. Activity against Trump from Republicans: "crickets".

This is how democracy and countries die. Checks and balances only work when someone is ready to write the checks if necessary. Republicans want only to cash checks from their largest donors.

If it can be proven, this should result in more than impeachment, since impeachment would only deliver the Presidency to ANOTHER person who benefited from Russian conspiracy. If this is proven, it should invalidate the election.

Though I'm not sure it'll be proven, since the investigation is up to Congress (controlled by Republicans and clearly not willing to act ethically) and the FBI (under Comey, who himself intervened in the election to help Trump).

This is obviously the losers of the election trying to undermine the lawfully elected government of the United States through a continuous campaign of lies, accusations and insinuations, never with any accompanying proof whatsoever, aided and abetted by Fake News. How many would support trials for sedition when the perpetrators are uncovered, no matter who they are?

I'd love to see Trump impeached but the Russian hack is an evidence free zone. The Clinton team pushed the hack as the reason she lost, nevermind her 44% negative rating before the election, her fealty to Wall Street, and her distancing form the working class .

The Dems will forever be in the cellar if they don't run more popular figures and cut their ties to Goldman Sachs.
Only one word is required to sum up what former President Obama's actions make him: a "patriot".

Russia is already disillusioned with Trump's unpredictability and instability. When they're completely tired of him, Putin will finish Trump politically. I just hope that not too much irremediable damage is done before Trump's gone.

We got Nixon, and we'll get Trump.

Trump has the ability to declassify any and all documents regarding contacts with Russian officials. Seems to me, if accusations are truly false, that he has every incentive to do so.

I would hope that all vigilant journalists with access to the administration are asking the question, "do you plan to declassify..." ad nauseum.

Donald Trump doesn't do subtle. He has telegraphed in every way he can that he is up to his neck in inappropriate Russian connections. But the party who put him in power seems to have gone blind, deaf, and mute to the obvious. This is so much bigger and more serious than White Water or Watergate. We have Russian assets now in charge of the White House and an AG who lied under oath about his own Russian connections.  We need the intelligence communities, the media, and the courts to protect us from the terrorists in charge.

What is most interesting is that these allegations have been on-going for months now and still there is not one piece of evidence that has been presented or verified. If there was truly evidence then why hasn't it been handed over to the FBI?

While I wish this was handled pre-election (and can understand why it wasn't), I'm glad the groundwork was laid out for investigators. Had this not happened, chances are none to none that anyone in the Trump administration would've investigated itself, particularly with Jeff Sessions heading up the DOJ.  Many thanks to the Obama administration for, once again, putting country first.

If I were a democrat, I'd be changing my party affiliation big time...I would not want to be affiliated with this group of haters...ever...completely disrespectful, intolerant, hypocritical ignoramuses...yep, I said it. Now, change to Independent!!!!!
This is the entire basis for our democracy, if the GOP doesn't want to investigate this then it's abundantly clear that they put the party over the country. Shameful.

Rush to preserve?  Why not just leave all the data in the government communications system so investigators can do their job?  Some Obama officials were rushing to delete damaging information, like with a rag, and other officials were rushing to preserve the truth. Why not just leave all the information in the government system? Honestly.

Republicans are so funny not to mention hypocritical when they rail against "leaks" to the MSM....they say they want to find out who is leaking and punish them....different tune when the leaks about Hillary Clinton and the DNC came out non-stop during the election....no problem...that was truth and Americans needed to know...

Yes, what goes around comes around...

This will not go away until Trump and Co. realize that they need to be transparent about their relationship with Putin and Co....they don't like the speculation? ....well, then you can make it stop by being truthful....yes, the truth does come out sooner or later.
Give Sessions immunity to sell out the rest of the administration! It seems to go deep and we need to know trump's involvement.

I clearly remember the end of the Nixon years when the Republican dead enders were still trying to cover up for him. The same thing appears to be going on now, but the floodgates will soon open and they either need to get out of the way or drown themselves. Some of them are already calling for a special prosecutor. And Jeff Sessions should resign and should be disbarred. Shameful, but not unanticipated. People have noted his character flaws for 30 years.

Sessions gave clever, safe answer... but yes, misleading and carefully correct in his mind's constructed context. Honest Abe, the president POTUS admires would,be so proud.
Maybe they were simply talking about branding a new Russkaya vodka, ... um, um, um "Trumpskaya," or maybe simply talking about the Russian River that they named in honor of President Trump.. "the Don River."
check it out, google it...
they didnt have anything . else they would have used it to defeat trump

Excuse me but, the Obama administration should have...? Buried the evidence? Destroyed it? What? Spun it?

I mean, this is newsworthy?

Let's not forget what the Russian "Hacking" was really all about.  It was the hacking of DNC emails and posting them on Wikileaks.  From that "hack" we learned all kinds of things about the inner works of the Democratic Party, from Debbie Schultz's role in helping to push Hillary Clinton forward in the primary election over that of Bernie Sanders (which led to her resignation), to Hillary's "private position" and "public positions" on issues to John Podesta's "Spirit Cooking" rituals.  None of it very flattering to their cause for sure.  If this had a bad effect on the outcome, then that is simply not the Russians fault.  If those email revelations had no effect on the outcome of the election, then Russian hacking had no effect, because that is essentially what the Russians did.

The arrogant certainty of a Hillary win was so pervasive across the DNC, White House and press that Obama didn't do what he should have done much earlier: Disclose the Trump/Russian alliance to steal the election. And if there was concern about anyone being prosecuted, he should have granted them pardons.
Both Trump's theft of the election and Obama's cowardice to act are both disgraceful.

Trump says wouldn't it be great if we got along with Russia. There are two unanswered questions: At what price and for whose benefit? .I wonder if Trump knows the difference between a con-man and a killer. He is over his head and does not know it.

russia
